excerpt: Elaborate statues & other structures line this spiritual site on the banks of the Ganges River.
detail_description: Triveni Ghat in Rishikesh is a renowned spiritual site located on the banks of the Ganges River. It holds great significance as it is believed to be the confluence point of three major rivers - Ganga, Yamuna, and Saraswati. According to Hindu mythology, taking a dip in the holy waters here is said to cleanse one of all sins. The ghat offers a serene and tranquil atmosphere, perfect for experiencing the spiritual aura of Rishikesh.
name: Triveni Ghat
address: Mayakund, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249201, India

excerpt: Ashram where the pop band once stayed in the ’60s, now featuring Beatles art & graffiti.
detail_description: The Beatles Ashram, located about 3 km from Lakshman Jhula in Rishikesh, was once a quiet place for yoga and meditation under Maharishi Mahesh Yogi. However, it gained global attention in 1968 when The Beatles visited to learn about Transcendental Meditation. Today, the ashram features Beatles art and graffiti. The area is a mystical campus with stunning architecture nestled in a forested area near the Ganges.
name: The Beatles Ashram
address: 4876+4V3, Swarg Ashram, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249304, India

excerpt: Mountainside temple & mythological site where the Hindu deity Shiva consumed poison from the sea.
detail_description: Shree Neelkanth Mahadev Temple is a significant Hindu pilgrimage site located 32 km from Rishikesh, nestled at an altitude of 1300m amidst the picturesque Himalayan region. The temple boasts stunning surroundings with lush valleys and towering mountains.
name: Shree Neelkanth Mahadev Temple
address: 38JR+C6G, Kotdwar - Pauri Rd, Kotdwar, Uttarakhand 246149, India

excerpt: Spacious Himalayan ashram with lush gardens, offering courses in yoga, meditation & Ayurveda.
detail_description: Parmarth Niketan Ashram is a spacious retreat nestled in the Himalayas, located along the banks of River Ganga in Rishikesh. It aims to promote visitors' well-being through yoga, meditation, and Ayurveda courses. The ashram offers a spiritual journey with morning prayers, yoga classes, meditation sessions, satsang and lectures, kirtan, and the renowned Ganga Aarti at sunset. Additionally, it provides Nature Cure and Ayurvedic treatments.
name: Parmarth Niketan Ashram
address: Near, Main Market Road, Ram Jhula, Swarg Ashram, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249304, India

detail_description: Ram Jhula, also known as Shivananda Jhula, is a 450ft suspension bridge that spans the Ganges River and connects the banks with Shivananda and Swarga ashrams. This iconic landmark in Rishikesh is a popular tourist spot offering mesmerizing views of the river and the lush greenery at the foothills of the Himalayas.
name: Ram Jhula
address: Swarg Ashram, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249137, India

detail_description: Laxman Jhula is a renowned suspension bridge over the Ganges River in Rishikesh, offering stunning views of the river and surrounding hills. The area is dotted with numerous cafes such as Royal Cafe, Ganga Beach Cafe, and German Bakery, each offering its own unique ambiance and culinary delights. Visitors can also enjoy a leisurely stroll across the iconic bridge or opt for a relaxing river cruise on a traditional wooden boat.
name: Laxman Jhula
address: Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249302, India

detail_description: Swarg Ashram, located on the banks of the Ganges River and surrounded by the Himalayan mountains, offers a serene retreat for those seeking peace and meditation. Visitors can participate in soul-cleansing rituals, attend spiritual discourses, practice yoga and meditation, and enjoy the tranquil gardens. This ashram is a compelling destination for spiritual seekers looking to understand their inner selves.
name: Swarg Ashram
address: Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249304, India

detail_description: Rishikund, also known as "Sage's Pond," is a sacred and serene water tank situated near the Triveni Ghat in Rishikesh, Uttarakhand, India. According to local belief, this pond was created by the touch of the sage Kubz and is said to possess healing properties.
name: Rishikund प्राचीन तालाब
address: 473X+HJ3, Mayakund, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249201, India

detail_description: Lakshman Jhula is a famous suspension bridge in Rishikesh, connecting Tapovan to Jonk village. According to Hindu mythology, it is believed that Lord Laxman crossed the Ganges at this spot using jute ropes. The bridge was built in 1930 to honor this feat and has since become a significant tourist attraction.
name: Lakshman Jhula
address: Taxi Stand, Laxman Jhula, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249302, India

detail_description: Shri Bharat Mandir is a revered ancient temple located in the heart of Rishikesh, known for its rich history and intricate carvings. It is believed to be one of the oldest religious sites in India, with legends dating its existence back to the same time as Rishikesh itself. The temple is dedicated to Lord Hrishikesh Narayan and houses an idol of Lord Vishnu carved from a single Shaligram stone.
name: Shri Bharat Mandir
address: 9, Ghat Rd, Mayakund, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249201, India

detail_description: When you explore Tervi Manzil Temple, you'll be captivated by its unique layout featuring thirteen floors, each exuding a profound sense of devotion. Unlike many other temples in Rishikesh that are dedicated to a single deity, this temple is home to multiple deities, providing visitors with the extraordinary chance to pay homage to them all in one place.
name: Tervi Manzil Temple
address: 48GJ+996, Laxman Jhula, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249302, India

detail_description: Jumpin Heights, located in Rishikesh, is a must-visit destination for adventure seekers. It offers a range of thrilling activities such as bungee jumping, flying fox, and giant swing. This spot is perfect for adrenaline junkies looking to experience extreme sports and the rush of jumping from great heights. Additionally, Jumpin Heights provides an ideal setting for pre-wedding photoshoots, capturing fun moments between couples amidst the excitement of bungee jumping.
name: Jumpin Heights- Marketing office
address: Badrinath Rd, opp. Hotel Dev Palace, Tapovan, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249137, India

detail_description: Situated in the serene Himalayan foothills, Omkarananda Ashram is a revered sanctuary for those seeking inner peace. Established in 1993 and located in Muni Ki Reti, this ashram offers breathtaking views of the River Ganga and surrounding mountains. It's a popular spot for spiritual seekers to immerse themselves in yoga, meditation, and spiritual teachings. The tranquil ambiance and panoramic vistas make it a must-visit destination in Rishikesh.
name: Omkarananda Ashram Himalayas
address: Swami Omkarananda Saraswati Rd, Ganga Vatika, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249137, India

excerpt: Muni Ki Reti is a town and a municipal council in Tehri Garhwal district in the Indian state of Uttarakhand. It lies close to the pilgrimage town of Rishikesh and is known for its ashrams, including the Divine Life Society of Sivananda Saraswati. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Muni Ki Reti, located in the Tehri Garhwal district of Uttarakhand, India, is a serene town near the pilgrimage site of Rishikesh. It is renowned for its numerous Hindu temples and ashrams, including the well-known Divine Life Society of Sivananda Saraswati. Just 6 km from Rishikesh city, Muni Ki Reti offers a tranquil atmosphere that attracts visitors seeking spiritual grounding and tranquility.
name: Muni Ki Reti
address: Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249137, India

excerpt: Hindu temple on the banks of the Ganges River, known for its decorative wall engravings.
detail_description: Lakshman Temple, located on the banks of the Ganges River in Rishikesh, is a significant Hindu temple known for its intricate wall engravings depicting scenes from history. According to Hindu mythology, this ancient temple is dedicated to Lord Lakshman, the younger brother of Lord Ram. It is believed that both brothers crossed the Ganges at this very spot. The temple's historical significance and striking sculptures attract visitors from around the world.
name: Lakshman Temple
address: 48GG+MHW, Tapovan, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249192, India

detail_description: Ram Jhula & Laxman Jhula Rd is home to two iconic iron suspension bridges situated just outside the bustling town of Rishikesh. The older of the two, Laxman Jhula, dates back to 1929, while Ram Jhula was constructed in 1986.
name: Ram Jhula & Laxman Jhula Rd
address: Swarg Ashram, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249304, India

excerpt: Bright, ornate ashram on the river banks with meditation sessions & yoga courses.
detail_description: The Divine Life Society, also known as Sivananda Ashram, is a vibrant and intricately designed spiritual retreat located on the banks of a river. It offers meditation sessions and yoga courses for visitors seeking a cultural and spiritual immersion. Situated in Rishikesh, India, this ashram is part of the renowned pilgrimage destination and provides a serene atmosphere where guests can learn about Hinduism and other spiritual traditions.
name: The Divine Life Society (Sivananda Ashram)
address: Badrinath Rd, near Ram Jhula, P.O, Shivanandanagar, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249192, India

excerpt: This 13-story Hindu temple perched along the banks of the Ganges River is open to the public.
detail_description: Trayambakeshwar Temple, also known as Tera Manzil Temple, is a 13-story Hindu temple located on the banks of the Ganges River in Rishikesh. Dating back to the 12th century, it is dedicated to Lord Shiva and features intricate stone carvings and representations of other deities like Ganesh. The temple's architectural splendor and historical significance make it a must-visit attraction in Rishikesh.
name: Trayambakeshwar Temple, Rishikesh
address: Shiv chowk, near trimbakeshwar temple, Laxman Jhula, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249302, India

excerpt: Abandoned former Transcendental Meditation ashram known for its Beatles artwork & lush overgrowth.
detail_description: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi's Ashram 'Shankaracharya Nagar' in Rishikesh is a famous abandoned former Transcendental Meditation ashram that gained popularity when the Beatles visited in the 1960s. This serene location, often referred to as the yoga capital of the world, is surrounded by lush forested slopes and dotted with ashrams, yoga institutes, and luxurious spa resorts.
name: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi's Ashram "Shankaracharya Nagar" (Rishikesh)
address: 4856+RVP, Swarg Ashram, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249304, India

detail_description: Anand Prakash Yoga Ashram & Retreat Center, located in Rishikesh, was established in 2007 by Chetana Panwar and Yogirishi Vishvketu. The ashram offers Akhanda Yoga, a non-sectarian style that combines teachings from various lineages. This includes a balanced practice of asanas, pranayama, meditation, and mantra chanting. Additionally, the center provides discussions on yoga philosophy and the yogic lifestyle.
name: Anand Prakash Yoga Ashram & Yoga Teacher Training Center
address: 48JG+HFM, Badrinath Rd, near SBI bank, Tapovan, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249192, India

detail_description: Nestled near Purani Jhadi in Rishikesh, Swami Dayananda Ashram offers a serene retreat for pilgrims seeking to delve into the study of Sanskrit and Vedantas. Founded by Swami Dayananda Saraswati in 1960, this tranquil ashram is home to a temple dedicated to Lord Shiva and a well-stocked library with over 5000 titles on various subjects.
name: Swami Dayananda Ashram, Sri Gangadhareswar Trust
address: Dayanand Ashram Rd, Dayananda Nagar, Chandreshwar Nagar, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249137, India

detail_description: Virbhadra Temple, located in the serene surroundings of Rishikesh, Uttarakhand, is a 1300-year-old temple dedicated to Lord Shiva in his fierce form. The temple holds great significance as it commemorates the story of Lord Shiva's anger after the dishonoring of his wife, Goddess Sati. The annual festival of Mahashivratri is celebrated with fervor at this ancient site.
name: Virbhadra Temple
address: Aam Bag, IDPL Colony, Veerbhadra, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249202, India

excerpt: Riverfront ashram offering a temple, devotee housing, retail shops & a large banyan tree.
detail_description: Geeta Bhawan, situated on the banks of the sacred River Ganga in Swargashram, Rishikesh, is a renowned ashram and dharamshala. It offers over 1,000 rooms for pilgrims visiting Haridwar and Rishikesh.
name: Gita Bhawan
address: 48C7+PQQ, Swargashram Rd, Swarg Ashram, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249304, India

detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque surroundings of Rishikesh, Himalayan Yog Ashram is a renowned center for traditional Himalayan Yoga Training and Ayurvedic healing. The ashram offers a serene and clean environment where spiritual seekers can embark on a journey of healing and tranquility. With programs such as yoga training, therapy, Ayurvedic treatments, detox, and anti-stress therapies, it provides a holistic approach to well-being.
name: Himalayan Yog Ashram Rishikesh
address: 256, Tapovan, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249192, India

excerpt: Adventure tour company offering whitewater rafting trips on the Ganges & add-ons like cliff-jumping.
detail_description: Rishikesh is a renowned destination in India for river rafting, offering heart-pounding adventures on the choppy River Ganga. The area boasts specialized camping and rafting packages with excellent safety measures. Visitors can experience the unadulterated beauty of the Himalayan foothills while navigating through exhilarating rapids and breathtaking views.
name: Rishikesh River Rafting
address: 1002, Avas Vikas Colony, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249201, India

detail_description: Madhuban Ashram, located in Muni-ki-Reti, serves as a gateway for the Char Dham pilgrimage. The ashram offers teachings on Bhakti-yoga and Vedic scriptures while providing budget stay options, a yoga center, health facilities, and an in-house restaurant. It is a tranquil sanctuary with a temple dedicated to Goddess Durga and provides a peaceful space for meditation. Devotees gather daily to sing praises to Lord Krishna.
name: Madhuban Ashram
address: Kailash Gate, Ram Jhula, Before, Muni Ki Reti, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249201, India

name: Ram Jhula
address: Rishikesh, Uttarakhand, India

detail_description: Nestled in the serene foothills of the Himalayas, Swami Rama Sadhaka Grama is a tranquil retreat that invites sincere seekers to immerse themselves in meditation and self-discovery. Founded by the revered Swami Rama in 1966 along the banks of the Ganges, this ashram offers a peaceful escape from everyday life, surrounded by lush gardens and a picturesque lotus pond.
name: Swami Rama Sadhaka Grama
address: Virpur Khurd, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249203, India

detail_description: Andhra Ashram, located near Laxman Jhula in Rishikesh, was founded by Swami Sachchidananda Saraswathy in 1930 to accommodate pilgrims from Andhra Pradesh. Run by South Indian individuals, the ashram aims to familiarize visitors with local language and culture. The premises include two temples - Sri Venkateswaravari Temple and Sri Chandramouleshwara Temple.
name: Andhra Ashram
address: 110, Shop No. 10, Laxman Jhula Rd, near Balaji Mandir, Chandreshwar Nagar, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249035, India

detail_description: Nirmal Ashram, located 4 km from Rishikesh's city center, is a spiritual and charitable institution founded in 1903 by Mahant Buddha Singh Ji Maharaj. It offers a serene escape for those seeking a spiritual retreat. The ashram includes a Gurudwara sahib situated near the picturesque Triveni Ghat, where visitors can experience the tranquility of the surroundings.
name: Nirmal Ashram
address: Nirmal Ashram, Nirmal Marg, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249201, India

detail_description: Rishikesh is a haven for adventure seekers, offering the thrilling experience of bungee jumping. Jumpin Heights is the go-to destination for this heart-pounding activity, boasting top-notch equipment and experienced crew members. In addition to bungee jumping, visitors can also enjoy flying foxes and giant swings at this adventure sports hub. The seamless booking process with professional guidance ensures a smooth and exhilarating experience for all adrenaline junkies.
name: Bungee Jumping in Rishikesh - Booking
address: Badrinath Rd, Muni Ki Reti, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249201, India

detail_description: Neergarh Waterfall Rd is a popular destination near Rishikesh, known for its stunning series of waterfalls that converge into one mighty 25 ft waterfall. The area offers a nature trail leading to the falls, with two bridges and a stream along the way. As you hike through the scenic forest, you'll encounter natural pools and refreshment shops. The road to Neergarh Waterfall provides breathtaking views of the Ganges and is home to playful monkeys.
name: Neergarh Waterfall Rd
address: Uttarakhand, India

detail_description: Camping in Rishikesh Shivpuri is a delightful experience nestled in the Himalayas. The campsite, just a short walk from the Ganga River, offers activities like bonfires, music, and delicious food. With packages starting at Rs 799, it's an affordable way to enjoy nature. The serene Ganges and picturesque scenery make for an unforgettable camping experience.
name: Camping in Rishikesh Shivpuri
address: Camping in, Road, Someshwar Nagar, Ganga Nagar, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249201, India

detail_description: Rishikesh, known as the Adventure capital of India, offers a plethora of thrilling activities for adrenaline junkies. From river rafting and cliff jumping to camping and rappelling, there's no shortage of adventure here. The region's towering mountains also provide opportunities for rock climbing, trekking, and mountaineering. Rafting enthusiasts flock to Rishikesh from around the world to take on the rapids and soak in the stunning scenery along the way.
name: Rafting In Rishikesh
address: Rishikesh - Chamba - Tehri Rd, Muni Ki Reti, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249137, India

detail_description: Little Buddha Cafe in Rishikesh offers a beach shack vibe with a stunning view of the Ganges and hills. The menu features a variety of global cuisines such as Indian, Italian, Israeli, Mexican, and Tibetan. Vegan options are available upon request, including the popular mango lassi with coconut milk. The cafe is known for its delicious breakfast options like sweet and savory pancakes, including the scrambled tofu pancake.
name: Little Buddha Cafe
address: Laxman Jhula Road, Lakshman Jhula, near Little Buddha Cafe, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249302, India

detail_description: Beatles Cafe Rishikesh is a must-visit spot for both Beatles fans and food enthusiasts. Located in the tranquil Tapovan area, this cafe offers a mesmerizing ambiance with stunning views of the Ganges valley. The cafe, previously known as 60s Cafe, sits near Lakshman Jhula on Paidal Marg and provides an unobstructed view of the majestic river. Guests can enjoy a delightful culinary experience while being serenaded by timeless Beatles melodies.
name: Beatles Cafe (cafe delmar)
address: Tapovan, Sarai, Paidal Marg, near divine resort Radhe Krishna Mandir, near Divine Resort, Laxman Jhula, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249192, India

detail_description: Rishikesh White River Rafting offers thrilling adventures on the Ganges River suitable for both beginners and experts. The experience can be enjoyed during the day or as a serene evening activity by sitting along the shores. However, it's important to note that rafting may be challenging and dangerous during rainy days. Additionally, it's advisable to avoid weekends due to heavy rush and inflated charges by some vendors.
name: Rishikesh White River Rafting
address: Badrinath NH-58, Bungee Jumping office, Tapovan Shivpuri, Neelkant Road, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand, India

detail_description: In Rishikesh, a city known for its spiritual significance, the Raghunath Temple stands as one of the most important sites for religious ceremonies. Dedicated to Lord Rama and Goddess Sita, this temple is located near Triveni Ghat and features a small water pond called Rishikund, where it's believed that Lord Ram bathed during his exile.
name: Raghunath temple
address: Shastri Bhavan, 55, Pragati Vihar, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249201, India

detail_description: Vanprastha Ashram is a serene spiritual retreat located within the Swarg Ashram complex, just 5 km from Rishikesh city center. Founded by Baba Kali Kamli Wale, it offers modern accommodation and spiritual activities for a peaceful stay. The ashram boasts neat and clean rooms at reasonable prices, with the added convenience of on-site parking.
name: Vanprastha Ashram
address: Vanprasth Ashram, Swarg Ashram, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249304, India

detail_description: Neelkanth Mahadev Temple is a significant shrine dedicated to Lord Shiva, located at an elevation of 1675 meters above Swarg Ashram in India. According to Hindu mythology, it marks the spot where Lord Shiva consumed the venom halahala from the churning of the ocean by Devas and Asuras. The temple offers a spiritual experience and is surrounded by natural beauty, making it a must-visit destination for travelers seeking cultural and religious insights.
name: Mahadev Mandir
address: 4887+Q7X, Swargashram Rd, Swarg Ashram, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249304, India

name: Rishikesh School of Yoga
address: Yoga St, Tapovan, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249192, India

excerpt: Prominent ashram with spiritual camps & classes, plus daily sacramental rites in a tranquil setting.
detail_description: Shantikunj Gayatri Parivar, also known as Gayatri Shakti Peeth, is a prominent ashram and the headquarters of All World Gayatri Pariwar. Established in 1971 by Pandit Shriram Sharma, it is located in a serene area on Rishikesh Road in Haridwar. The ashram offers spiritual camps, classes, and daily sacramental rites, attracting millions of followers worldwide.
name: Shantikunj Gayatri Parivar
address: Shantikunj, Shanti Kunj, Shantikunj Rd, Motichur, Haridwar, Motichur Range, Uttarakhand 249411, India

excerpt: Rishikesh is a city in India’s northern state of Uttarakhand, in the Himalayan foothills beside the Ganges River. The river is considered holy, and the city is renowned as a center for studying yoga and meditation. Temples and ashrams (centers for spiritual studies) line the eastern bank around Swarg Ashram, a traffic-free, alcohol-free and vegetarian enclave upstream from Rishikesh town.
detail_description: Rishikesh, situated in the Himalayan foothills beside the Ganges River, is a revered city known for its focus on yoga and meditation. The eastern bank of the river is adorned with temples and ashrams, creating a tranquil environment ideal for spiritual studies. The city offers various yoga teacher training programs including Hatha, Ashtanga, Vinyasa, Kundalini, Ayurveda Therapy and more. These programs are designed to provide a deep understanding of yoga philosophy and principles.
name: Rishikesh
address: Uttarakhand, India

excerpt: Elaborate statues & other structures line this spiritual site on the banks of the Ganges River.
detail_description: Triveni Ghat in Rishikesh is a significant spiritual site located on the banks of the Ganges River. It is considered the biggest and busiest ghat along the river, holding immense religious importance for Hindus. The evening Aarti, known as Maha Aarti, is a pure and sacred ritual that attracts many devotees. This ghat is renowned for its serene ambiance during early morning hours when visitors can witness the tranquil beauty of sunrise and experience a profound sense of peace.
name: Triveni Ghat
address: Mayakund, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249201, India

detail_description: Ram Jhula is a stunning bridge that spans the Ganges River, offering a picturesque and spiritual experience. While it can be crowded, the journey to the bridge is filled with interesting sights such as monkeys and wandering cows. Walking is recommended over renting a vehicle, allowing you to enjoy shopping, snacks, and tea along the way. From Ram Jhula Ghat, you can witness the divine Ganga Aarti in a less crowded setting than at Paramathma Ghat.
name: Ram Jhula
address: Swarg Ashram, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249137, India

excerpt: This 13-story Hindu temple perched along the banks of the Ganges River is open to the public.
detail_description: Trayambakeshwar Temple, also known as Tera Manzil Mandir, is a striking 13-story Hindu temple located on the banks of the Ganges River in Rishikesh. Each floor of the temple houses a series of mini-temples dedicated to various gods and goddesses, adorned with captivating murals and statues. This renowned landmark offers visitors a chance to seek divine blessings while marveling at its unique architecture and enjoying panoramic views of the sacred Ganges River.
name: Trayambakeshwar Temple, Rishikesh
address: Shiv chowk, near trimbakeshwar temple, Laxman Jhula, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand 249302, India

name: Patna Waterfall
address: 4978+V22, Patna, Uttarakhand 249302, India

detail_description: Nim Beach, also known as Neem Beach, is a serene white-brown sand beach located in Rishikesh near the Badrinath-Haridwar National Highway road. It is renowned for its beach yoga and offers a 9 km rafting experience. The beach pavilion provides breathtaking views of the river and a peaceful place to unwind amidst stunning natural surroundings. Visitors can enjoy the crystal-clear waters of River Ganga and the almost white sand while soaking in the tranquil ambiance.
name: Nim Beach
address: 48MJ+8RQ, Haridwar Rishikesh Badrinath Rd, Jonk, Uttarakhand 249137, India

detail_description: If you're looking for a taste of Goa in Rishikesh, then the Goa Beach is the place to be. Situated just 200 meters from Ram Jhula, this spot is often referred to as a Mini Goa beach and is a popular attraction in Rishikesh. Despite being currently off-limits by local authorities, it's known for its serene and picturesque beauty, offering visitors a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle.
name: Goa Beach Rishikesh
address: 48MM+5PH, near District magistrate camp office, Rishikesh, Jonk, Uttarakhand 249302, India
